attributes.comment:
I would like to request that you reconsider increasing the fees for this particular
petition. I recently received approval for this very petition. My family is not a
wealthy family, and if the fees for adoption were much higher we would not be able
to afford the costs. Any increase, no matter how minimal it may seem, would be
detrimental to so many families that are considering opening their home to a child
that doesn't have one.

I have read several comments that some have posted about this proposal saying
that they had an unpleasant experience with USCIS. Fortunately, I can say that I
was very pleased with the timeframe in which the Atlanta office handled our case.
However, the first approval letter that we received had the incorrect name on it.
When we contacted that Atlanta office to tell them of this error, we informed them
that this name was not on our application, nor was it on our birth certificate. We
were in turn called liars. When we sent the information to the office that proved we
were telling the truth, our corrected approval letter was sent remarkably quickly! I
know that this isn't the place to complain about these things, but I believe that the
fees we pay for these filings should include some service, and I must say the fee
that we paid was not worth being called a liar. Thank you for your time.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Gerald Cochrane II
